member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO
member.summary: TheIP_ADAPTER_INFO structure contains information about a particular network adapter on the local computer.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO.Next
member.summary: A pointer to the next adapter in the list of adapters.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO.AdapterName
member.summary: An ANSI character string of the name of the adapter.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO.Description
member.summary: An ANSI character string that contains the description of the adapter.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO.AddressLength
member.summary: The length, in bytes, of the hardware address for the adapter.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO.Address
member.summary: The hardware address for the adapter represented as a BYTE array.

summary.para: The adapter index may change when an adapter is disabled and then enabled, or under other circumstances, and should not be considered persistent.
The adapter type. Possible values for the adapter type are listed in the Ipifcons.h header file.
The table below lists common values for the adapter type although other values are possible on Windows Vista and later.

listheader.description: Some other type of network interface.

An IEEE 802.11 wireless network interface.
Note This adapter type is returned on Windows Vista and later. On Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP , an IEEE 802.11 wireless network interface returns an adapter type of MIB_IF_TYPE_ETHERNET.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO.DhcpEnabled
member.summary: An option value that specifies whether the dynamic host configuration protocol (DHCP) is enabled for this adapter.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO.IpAddressList
member.summary: The list of IPv4 addresses associated with this adapter represented as a linked list of IP_ADDR_STRING structures. An adapter can have multiple IPv4 addresses assigned to it.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO.GatewayList
member.summary: The IPv4 address of the gateway for this adapter represented as a linked list of IP_ADDR_STRING structures. An adapter can have multiple IPv4 gateway addresses assigned to it. This list usually contains a single entry for IPv4 address of the default gateway for this adapter.

summary.para: The IPv4 address of the DHCP server for this adapter represented as a linked list of IP_ADDR_STRING structures. This list contains a single entry for the IPv4 address of the DHCP server for this adapter. A value of 255.255.255.255 indicates the DHCP server could not be reached, or is in the process of being reached.
This member is only valid when the DhcpEnabled member is nonzero.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_INFO.HaveWins
member.summary: An option value that specifies whether this adapter uses the Windows Internet Name Service (WINS).

summary.para: The IPv4 address of the primary WINS server represented as a linked list of IP_ADDR_STRING structures. This list contains a single entry for the IPv4 address of the primary WINS server for this adapter.
This member is only valid when the HaveWins member is TRUE.
The IPv4 address of the secondary WINS server represented as a linked list of IP_ADDR_STRING structures. An adapter can have multiple secondary WINS server addresses assigned to it.
This member is only valid when the HaveWins member is TRUE.
The time when the current DHCP lease was obtained.
This member is only valid when the DhcpEnabled member is nonzero.
The time when the current DHCP lease expires.
This member is only valid when the DhcpEnabled member is nonzero.
